Assessment

Week 1

  • How this course works
  • Review semester's assignments.
  • Weekly Quizzes
  • CAL letters of accommodation require advanced notice to faculty.
  • Present for Micro-Quiz: Variable Fonts
  • Project:
  • Present the project, review assignment pages
  • Challenge: Context-appropriate, minimalist design
  • Review invitation content
  • Production specifications
  • Refer students to basic type rules
  • Learning Activity:
  • Point type vs Area Type in Illustrator
  • Type selection
  • Informal grids
  • Due Next: Your concept

Week 2

  • Due before class: Your concept
  • Elect class rep.
  • Micro-Quiz: Variable Fonts
  • Present for Micro-Quiz: Slanted vs. Italic
  • Project: Save the Date, cont'd
  • Public, open crit.
  • Present any teachables observed during crit.
  • File prep for print production.
  • 2nd half of class:
  • Implement changes provided during crit.
  • Submit progress on Brightspace.
  • Due Next: Save the Date, Final

Week 5

  • Due before class: Menu Concept Pitch
  • Quiz: The Manicule.
  • Present for Micro-Quiz: Trademark & Copyright Symbols
  • Current Project: The Art of the Menu
  • Presentation:
  • Clean up text with GREP.
  • My menu page.
  • Anchored objects. Use beer promo graphic and fruit icons.
  • Typeset menu items. Tabs, prices with GREP, etc…
  • Accurate bleeds in InDesign
  • Critique Mood Boards
  • Due Next: Menu design pages WIP

Week 6

  • Due before class: Menu design WIP on Brightspace.
  • Quiz: Trademark & Copyright Symbols.
  • Present for Micro-Quiz: Anatomy of Serifs
  • Project: The Art of the Menu
  • Presentation:
  • Feedback based on student WIP. Show examples of what to do and what to avoid.
  • Learning Activity:
  • Due Next:

Week 8

Week 9

  • Due Next: Concept Development
